item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description:
Download my latest cv

Post-Secondary Education

2012-          PhD in Bioinformatics, University of British Columbia,                     Vancouver, BC, Canada
                    under CIHR Bioinformatics Training Program
                    Supervisors: Dr. Colin Collins and
                    Dr. Cenk Sahinalp

2011-2012   MSc in Bioinformatics, Simon Fraser University                     Burnaby, BC, Canada
                    under CIHR Bioinformatics Training Program
                    (transferred to PhD)

2005-2009   BTech in Biotechnology, Kathmandu University                     Kavre, Nepal

Research & Training Experience

2012-                PhD Scholar, Vancouver Prostate Centre
                          Dr. Colin Collins’s Laboratory
                          Dr. Cenk Sahinalp’s Laboratory

Jan-Apr 2012    Grad. Research Student, Simon Fraser University
                          Dr. Fiona Brinkman’s Laboratory

Jan-Apr 2012    Grad. Research Student, Simon Fraser University
                          Dr. Jack Chen’s Laboratory

2009-2011         Research Associate
                           Center for Molecular Dynamics Nepal, Nepal

Jan-Jun 2009    Undergrad. Research Student, Genetics Nepal

Awards and Honors

2016-2018     Mitacs Accelerate PhD Fellowship

2015-2016     Prostate Cancer Foundation-BC (PCF-BC)
                       Research Awards-2015

2014-2016     Faculty of Science Graduate Award
                       University of British Columbia

2014            International Society for Computational Biology (ISCB)
                   Travel Fellowship (RECOMB-2014)

2011-2013     CIHR Bioinformatics Training Program Fellowship

List of my publications (click here)

Selected Talks

Translating Big-Data to Precision Oncology. Vancouver Prostate Centre / Terry Fox Seminar, February 17, 2017, Vancouver General Hospital, Vancouver, Canada.

HIT’nDRIVE: Patient-Specific Multi-Driver Gene Prioritization for Precision Oncology. Vancouver Bioinformatics User Group (VanBUG) November 3, 2016, Vancouver, Canada.

HIT’nDRIVE: Patient-Specific Multi-Driver Gene Prioritization for Precision Oncology. 10th Annual Lorne D. Sullivan Lectureship & Research Day. June 21, 2016, Vancouver General Hospital, Vancouver, Canada.

HIT’nDRIVE: Patient-Specific Multi-Driver Gene Prioritization to Guide Precision Cancer Medicine. Workshop on Network Biology, Algorithmic Challenges in Genomics. April 11-15, 2016. Simons Institute, UC Berkley, Berkley, CA, USA.

Computational Detection and Prioritization of Driver Alterations in Cancer. Vancouver Prostate Centre / Terry Fox Seminar, November 3, 2014, Vancouver General Hospital, Vancouver, Canada.

HIT’nDRIVE: Multi-Driver Gene Prioritization based on Hitting Time. 18th Annual International Conference on Research in Computational Molecular Biology (RECOMB). April 2-5, 2014, Pittsburgh, PA, USA.

Selected Poster Presentations

Shrestha R, et al (2016). HIT’nDRIVE: Patient-Specific Multi-Driver Gene Prioritization for Precision Oncology. The 27th International Conference on Genome Informatics, October 3-5, 2016, Fudan University, Shanghai, China.

Nabavi N, Shrestha R, et al (2016). Characterization of intertumor heterogeneity in Malignant Mesothelioma. 13th International Conference of the International Mesothelioma Interest Group (iMIG 2016), May 1-4, 2016, Birmingham, UK. (As a first co-author).

Shrestha R, et al (2015). Computational Detection and Prioritization of Driver Alterations in Prostate Cancer from Multi-Omics Data. Eighth Annual Prostate Cancer Program Retreat (SPORE), March 15-17, 2015, Fort Lauderdale, Florida, USA. (Selected among the top-eight poster of the conference)

Shrestha R, et al (2013). Exploring the Biology of Prostate Cancer Progression using Systems Biology Approach. The Eleventh Asia Pacific Bioinformatics Conference, January 21-23, 2013, Vancouver, Canada.

International Conferences Attended/Presented

The 4th Canadian Cancer Research Conference Nov. 5-7, 2017, Vancouver, BC, Canada.

The American Society of Human Genetics 66th Annual Meeting, October 18-22, 2017, Vancouver, BC, Canada.

The 27th International Conference on Genome Informatics, October 3-5, 2016, Fudan University, Shanghai, China.

Workshop on Network Biology (Algorithmic Challenges in Genomics). April 11-15, 2016, Simons Institute for the Theory of Computing, UC Berkeley, Berkeley, CA, USA.

The PanCancer Analysis of Whole Genomes (PCAWG) Meeting. April 7-8, 2016, Barcelona, Spain.

Eighth Annual Prostate Cancer Program Retreat (SPORE), March 15-17, 2015, Fort Lauderdale, Florida, USA.

18th Annual International Conference on Research in Computational Molecular Biology (RECOMB). April 2-5, 2014, Pittsburgh, PA, USA.

The Eleventh Asia Pacific Bioinformatics Conference, January 21-23, 2013, Vancouver, BC, Canada.

Academic Papers Refereed

(number of reviews parenthesized)

  • Nature Communications (3)

  • BMC Genomics (1)

  • BMC Bioinformatics (1)

  • Bioinformatics (1)

  • Research in Computational Molecular Biology (RECOMB) (2)

  • International Conference on Intelligent Systems for Molecular Biology (ISMB) (1)

  • The Asia Pacific Bioinformatics Conference (APBC) (1)

  • Workshop on Algorithms in Bioinformatics (WABI) (1)

  • Nepal Journal of Biotechnology reviewer (7)
